rules.rationale: The largest table in the study (8,184 vars). Name is self-descriptive — comprehensive baseline clinical assessment for urea cycle disorder patients.
Name is self-descriptive — drug and other treatment data for managing urea cycle disorders (nitrogen scavengers, dietary protein restriction, etc.). 1,054 vars.

'neuropsych' prefix tables (forms A through F) contain standardized neuropsychological test batteries. Cognitive impairment is a major outcome in urea cycle disorders due to hyperammonemia. 121-400 vars per form.
Name is self-descriptive — clinical lab results including ammonia levels (key biomarker for urea cycle disorders), amino acids, liver function. 379 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — medical and developmental history, important for tracking developmental milestones in pediatric urea cycle disorder patients. 314 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — physical examination data. 235 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — interim clinical events between scheduled visits (e.g. hyperammonemic crises, hospitalizations). 180 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — enrollment and demographic data. 161 vars.
Nutrient/dietary intake data. Protein restriction is a primary treatment for urea cycle disorders, making dietary monitoring critical. 115 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — eligibility criteria form. 92 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — medical record review abstracting clinical data. 80 vars.

Quality of life instruments: SF-36 (adults), PedsQL 4.0 (pediatric, parent and child versions), and UCDC-specific QoL forms. Table names contain 'qualityoflife', 'sf_36', or 'pedsql'. 17-43 vars each.
Name is self-descriptive — adverse event reporting. 37 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — death records. Urea cycle disorders have significant mortality risk from hyperammonemic crises. 26 vars.
Truncated name variant 'p5101_16898_neuropsyc' — same neuropsychological testing as the neuropsychform* tables. 15 vars.
'ae_mro' = adverse event medical review officer review. Secondary review of adverse events for safety monitoring. 14 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — study completion or withdrawal form. 11 vars.
Truncated name 'p5101_16897_familyhis' — family history questionnaire. Important because urea cycle disorders are inherited (autosomal recessive or X-linked). 7 vars.
Name is self-descriptive — study registration form. 5 vars.
